data.title: List of Popular Ancient Chinese TV Series 1993
data.meta_description: There's just something special about the wuxia genre in addition to the exquisite costumes and beautiful scenery. In series set in ancient China, the stakes are high, honor means everything, I could go on...
data.text:
Very often, I look for recommendations on the next wuxia to watch. Thought I would share a list of popular ancient Chinese TV series, from my top 20 to the ones that you watch to pass time.

There’s just something special about the wuxia genre in addition to the exquisite costumes and beautiful scenery. In period dramas, the stakes are higher, honor means everything, I could go on…

Help spread the c-drama love by turning this into a group effort. If you would like to contribute your thoughts on a certain drama, contact us with a short writeup and we can include it directly in the post below.

Mei Ren Zhi Zao

Is it a must-watch, pretty good, just another drama, tolerable or downright boring?

My Ratings: Just Another Drama

Title：Mei Ren Zhi Zao / 美人制造

Episodes and Genre: 30, Fantasy / Comedy

Starring: 2013

Jin Shi Jia as He Lan Jun

Synopsis:

True to its namesake, the drama revolves around He Lan Jun, a highly skilled cosmetic surgeon and the adventures he encounters as he tries to make a name for himself.—-

Swordsman (Xiao Ao Jiang Hu)

2013 Version

Is it a must-watch, pretty good, just another drama, tolerable or downright boring?

My Ratings: Pretty Good for the most part

Title：Swordsman / Xiao Ao Jiang Hu / 笑傲江湖

Episodes and Genre: 42, Action Romance

Starring: 2013

Wallace Huo as Ling Hu Chong

Chen Qiao En as Dong Fang Bu Bai

Synopsis:

Ling Hu Chong is a student of the Hua Shan Sect and this story revolves around his adventures as he makes a name for himself in the martial arts world.

Comments:

Based on novels by Louis Cha (Jin Yong). I decided to feature the most recent adaptation produced by Yu Zheng in 2013. Usually, Jin Yong novels are a must-watch for me but in this case, Yu Zheng took free reign at revising major plot points. I can accept some modifications such as Dong Fang Bu Bai being female rather than male but other story changes just didn’t make sense.

It was frustrating to see how the original pairing was supposed to be Ling Hu Chong and Ren Ying Ying but we spend a huge chunk of the drama watching the development behind Ling Hu Chong and Dong Fang Bu Bai’s possibly romantic relationship.

Chen Qiao En as Dong Fang Bu Bai is captivating and she quickly became my favorite character so I was quite appalled when it dawned on me how this drama was supposed to play out. I stopped watching shortly before that could happen.

Female Prime Minister

Is it a must-watch, pretty good, just another drama, tolerable or downright boring?

My Ratings: Must-Watch

Title：Female Prime Minister / 陆贞传奇

Episodes and Genre: 59, Hunan TV

Starring: May 2013

Zhao Li Ying as Lu Zhen

Chen Xiao as Gao Zhan

Synopsis:

Lu Zhen is an intelligent and courageous young women who doesn’t let gender inhibit her from succeeding in business. Upon her father’s death, her evil stepmother leaves her with nothing and Lu Zhen ends up escaping to the palace where she relies on wits and talent to survive.

Rift of the Sky (Xuan Yuan Jian)

Is it a must-watch, pretty good, just another drama, tolerable or downright boring?

My Ratings: Just Another Drama

Title：Rift of the Sky / Xuan Yuan Jian Zhi Tian Zhi Hen / 轩辕剑之天之痕

Episodes and Genre: 36, Action Romance / Fantasy

Starring: 2012

Hu Ge as Yu Wen Tuo

Jiang Jing Fu as Chen Jing Chou

Liu Shi Shi as Taba Yu Er

Tiffany Tang as Ningke

Synopsis:

Yu Wen Tuo and Chen Jing Chou are destined to be enemies. Will they be able to set aside their differences and save the world?

Comments:

Produced by Tangren Media.

Visually amazing as always, I watched it just for the sake of the cast and the colorful costumes. Can’t say the same about the story tho. More pictures below because it’s a waste not to post them.

The Emperor’s Harem

Is it a must-watch, pretty good, just another drama, tolerable or downright boring?

My Ratings: Just Another Drama

Title：The Emperor’s Harem / Hou Gong / 后宫

Episodes and Genre: 46, Romance Drama

Starring: 2011

Ady An as Shao Chun Hua / Li Zi Yun

Feng Shao Feng as Yang Yong

Synopsis:

Despite coming from a noble background, Li Zi Yun was forced to live on the streets after her father was accused of treason. Fortunately, she was taken in by a nice family as a servant. However, the palace decreed that the family’s only daughter be sent to the palace.

To repay her master’s kindness, Zi Yun goes to the palace as Shao Chun Hwa where she gets entangled by the endless hierarchies and power play behind the palace’s closed walls.

Is it a must-watch, pretty good, just another drama, tolerable or downright boring?

My Ratings: Must Watch

Title：Gong / 宫-锁心玉

Episodes and Genre: 39, Romance, Fantasy Time Travel, Historical

Starring: 2011

Yang Mi as Luo Qing Chuan

Feng Shao Feng as Yin Se (8th Prince)

Synopsis:

Ever noticed a trend in dramas where similar themes come out all at ones. Gong is yet another time-travel drama which is a cross between Scarlet Heart and Boys Over Flowers. We have a feisty 21st century heroine constantly picked on by the boys / princes yet the stakes are much higher within the palace walls of Qing Dynasty where one wrong move can cost your life.

Is it a must-watch, pretty good, just another drama, tolerable or downright boring?

Title：Legend of Zhen Huan / Empresses in the Palace / Zhen Huan Zhuan / 后宫甄嬛传

Episodes and Genre: 76, Historical

Broadcast Period: 2012

Starring:

Sun Li as Zhen Huan

Synopsis:

An innocent young woman marries the Qing Dynasty emperor and learns to thrive amidst the scheming within the inner court until she ascends into a position of utmost power.—

Is it a must-watch, pretty good, just another drama, tolerable or downright boring?

My Ratings: Must Watch

Title：Scarlet Heart / Startling By Each Step / Bu Bu Jing Xin / 步步惊心

Episodes and Genre: 35, Romance, Fantasy Time Travel, Historical

Starring: 2011

Liu Shi Shi as Maertai Ruo Xi / Zhang Xiao

Nicky Wu as Yin Zhen (4th Prince)

Synopsis:

Zhang Xiao got into a fight with her boyfriend because she caught him cheating. However, she trips and is electrocuted. When she wakes up, she discovers that she has been transported back into the Qing Dynasty inside the body of Maertai Ruo Xi.

Stuck with no idea on how to go back to the future, she tries to make the most of it but is struggling with the fact that she already knows how history will play out for everyone that she meets.

Comments:

Produced by Tangren Media.

Strange Hero Yi Zhi Mei

Is it a must-watch, pretty good, just another drama, tolerable or downright boring?

My Ratings: Pretty Good

Title：Strange Hero Yi Zhi Mei / The Vigilantes in Masks / Guai Xia Yi Zhi Mei / 怪侠一枝梅

Episodes and Genre: 30, Action

Starring: 2011

Wallace Huo as Li Ge Xiao

Liu Shi Shi as Yan San Niang

Synopsis:

Li Ge Xiao is a bandit that robs the rich to give to the poor. His group is called Yi Zhi Mei and they fight to protect the people.

Comments:

Produced by Tangren Media.

Meteor Butterfly Sword

Is it a must-watch, pretty good, just another drama, tolerable or downright boring?

My Ratings: Just Another Drama

Title：Meteor Butterfly Sword / Liu Xing Hu Die Jian / 流星蝴蝶剑

Episodes and Genre: 30, Action Romance

Starring: 2010

Baron Chen as Meng Xing Hun

Synopsis:

Meng Xing Hun is an assassin of the Happy Forest led by Sister Ko. They are experts in the field but Xing Hun is tired of their lifestyle and wants to start anew.

Comments:

Based on Gu Long novels. The movie version starring Tony Leung, Michelle Yeoh and many more is my favorite wuxia film but I didn’t like the drama version as much.

Is it a must-watch, pretty good, just another drama, tolerable or downright boring?

My Ratings: Pretty Good

Title：Chinese Paladin 3 / Xian Jian Qi Xia Zhuan 3 / 仙剑奇侠传3

Episodes and Genre: 37, Action Romance / Fantasy

Starring: 2009

Hu Ge as Jing Tian

Yang Mi as Tang Xue Jian

Synopsis:

Jing Tian, a happy-go-lucky shop owner, embarks on a journey to save the world from darkness.

Comments:

Produced by Tangren Media. This is a prequel to Chinese Paladin.

Heavenly Sword and Dragon Sabre (Yi Tian Tu Long Ji)

2009 Version

2003 Version

Is it a must-watch, pretty good, just another drama, tolerable or downright boring?

My Ratings: Must Watch

Title：Heavenly Sword and Dragon Sabre / 倚天屠龙记

Episodes and Genre: 40, Action Romance

Starring: 2003

Alec Su (苏有朋) as Zhang Wu Ji (张无忌)

Alyssa Chia (贾静雯) as Zhao Min (赵敏)

2009

Deng Chao as Zhang Wu Ji

Ady An as Zhao Min

Synopsis:

The Martial Arts world is fighting over the Heavenly Sword and Dragon Sabre and it leads to the untimely deaths of Zhang Wu Ji’s parents. Wu Zi has to decide between principle or revenge, love or hate as he becomes entangled in the fight over the Heavenly Sword and Dragon Sabre.

Comments:

Based on Louis Cha (Jin Yong) novels. Yang Xiao (杨逍) is my favorite character because of the 1993 version played by Sun Xing (孙兴). His portrayal of Yang Xiao left such an impression that I don’t think other versions can ever compare. Here’s Sun Xing from the 1993 version. Oh, the memories..

Demi-Gods and Semi-Devils (Tian Long Ba Bu)

2013 Version

2003 Version

1997 Version

Is it a must-watch, pretty good, just another drama, tolerable or downright boring?

My Ratings: Must Watch

Title：Demi-Gods and Semi-Devils / Tian Long Ba Bu / 天龙八部 (天龍八部)

Genre: Action / Romance

Starring: 1997 (TVB)

Huang Re Hua (黄日华) as Qiao Feng (乔峰)

Benny Chan (陈浩民) as Duan Yu (段誉)

Carman Lee (李若彤) as Wang Yu Yuan (王语嫣)

2003

Hu Jun as Qiao Feng (乔峰)

Jimmy Lin as Duan Yu (段誉)

Liu Yi Fei as Wang Yu Yan (王语嫣)

2013

Wallace Chung as Qiao Feng

Kim Ki Bum as Duan Yu

Han Dong as Xu Zhu

Synopsis:

Qiao Feng is the leader of the Beggar Clan who defends the Han people from the Qi Dan. Duan Yu is a prince of Da Li who despises fighting and violence. Xu Zhu is a monk who inadvertently gains immense martial arts powers that he did not want. The three become sworn brothers and this is their story.

Comments:

Based on Louis Cha (Jin Yong) novels. In my opinion, Jin Yong is like the Chinese version of George Lucas as he successfully created a franchise on stories filled with generations of unforgettable characters.

I really think that if you like one, you’ll like them all.–

The Return of the Condor Heroes (Shen Diao Xia Lu)

2015 Version

2006 Version

1998 Version

1995 Version

Is it a must-watch, pretty good, just another drama, tolerable or downright boring?

My Ratings: Must Watch

Title: The Return of the Condor Heroes / 神雕侠侣

Genre: Action / Romance

Starring: 1995 Version

Louis Koo (古天乐) as Yang Guo (杨过)

Carman Lee (李若彤) as Xiao Long Nu (小龙女)

1998 Version

Christopher Lee (李铭顺) as Yang Guo (杨过)

Fann Wong (范文芳) as Xiao Long Nu (小龙女)

2006 Version

Huang Xiao Ming (黄晓明) as Yang Guo (杨过)

Crystal Liu (刘亦菲) as Xiao Long Nu (小龙女)

2014 Version

Chen Xiao as Yang Guo

Michelle Chen as Xiao Long Nu

Synopsis:

Yang Guo is judged by society for being the son of a traitor. He meets and falls in love with his martial arts teacher, Xiao Long Nu, and their relationship has been deemed unacceptable by society.

Comments:

Based on Louis Cha (Jin Yong) novels. I really like Yang Guo, a character who is not your typical protagonist. He has a dark side and in spite of society’s expectation that a traitor’s son can do no good, he embodies the characteristics of a true hero.

I think the 2006 version by Crystal Liu (刘亦菲) is the most fitting for the part of ethereal beauty Xiao Long Nu but Fann Wong’s portrayal, which is the first version that I ever saw will always be my favorite.

On the other hand, the 2014 upcoming version starring Michelle Chen seems to be getting a lot of flak for her casting and unwanted changes in the screenplay. I guess it’s up to us to decide.

A Step Into the Past

Is it a must-watch, pretty good, just another drama, tolerable or downright boring?

My Ratings: Must Watch

Title：A Step into the Past / 尋秦記 / 寻秦记

Episodes: 40

Air Date and Genre: 2001, Time Travel / Comedy / Action / Romance

Starring:

Louis Koo (古天樂) as Xiang Shao Long (项少龙)

Raymond Lam (林峰) as Zhao Pan（赵盘）

Synopsis:

Hong Siu Lung is a Hong Kong Police Agent afraid to commit to his long-time girlfriend Kam Ching. It was only until Kam Ching marries another that Hong Siu Lung realizes what he lost. Determined to win Kam Ching back, Hong Siu Lung volunteers to travel back into the past in hopes of undoing the present. However, things go awry when he finds himself stuck in ancient China many thousand years ago.

Comments:

It was hilarious to watch Louis Koo (古天樂) as Hong Siu Lung (项少龙) speak English and walk around in a T-shirt in ancient China.

The Prince of Lan Ling (Lan Ling Wang) – a ratings powerhouse!

Is it a must-watch, pretty good, just another drama, tolerable or downright boring?

My Rating: Must-Watch

Title：Lan Ling Wang aka the Prince of Lan Ling / 蘭陵王 / 兰陵王

Episodes: 46

Air Date and Genre: August 2013, Action / Romance

Starring:

Feng Shao Feng (冯绍峰) as Lan Ling Wang (兰陵王)

Ariel Lin (林依晨) as Yang Xue Wu (雪舞)

Daniel Chan (陈晓东) as Yu Wen Yong (宇文邕)

Synopsis:

During the turbulent times of the warring states, there are four men with the potential to unite the lands and bring forth peace, one of which is Lan Ling Wang, a general of Qi. Lan Ling Wang meets Yang Xue Wu, the granddaughter of the last remaining priestess from the village of seers. It has been foretold that the one who gains her, gains the world.Despite the tragic prophecy that Lan Ling Wang will die in the hands of his own brother, Yang Xue Wu falls deeply in love. WIll they triumph against fate?

Comments: Loved the three leads & the supporting cast and hated Zhen Er with a passion thanks to her superb acting. It’s rare for me to find new dramas to like so Lan Ling Wang seriously reminded me of the good old times when I first discovered period dramas.

Though I gotta admit, there was a fair-share of hair pulling moments when the drama started dragging midway but still an enjoyable ride overall.

The Legend of the Condor Heroes (She Diao Ying Xiong Zhuan)

2008 Version – A Tang Ren Production

2004 Version

1994 Version

Is it a must-watch, pretty good, just another drama, tolerable or downright boring?

My Ratings: Pretty Good

Title：Legend of the Condor Heroes / 射雕英雄传

Episodes and Genre: 1994 Version – 35, 2008 Version – 50, Action Romance

Starring:1994 Version

Zhilin Cheung (张智霖) as Guo Jing（郭靖）

Athena Chu (朱茵) as Huang Rong（黄蓉）

2003 Version

Li Yapeng (李亚鹏) as Guo Jing（郭靖）

Zhou Xun (周迅) as Huang Rong（黄蓉）

2008 Version

Hu Ge (胡歌) as Guo Jing（郭靖）(main guy in Chinese Paladin)

Ariel Lin (林依晨) as Huang Rong（黄蓉）(main girl in It Started with a Kiss)

Synopsis:

Guo Jing is slow and dim-witted but he is persevering and has a good heart. He meets Huang Rong who is his antithesis, smart, pretty and cunning. This novel adaptation revolves around their love story as well as Guo Jing’s journey to becoming a great warrior who defends ancient China from the Jin empire.

Comments:

Based on Louis Cha (Jin Yong) novels. This series is the prequel to the Return of the Condor Heroes.

My Fair Princess – a ratings powerhouse!

2011 Version

1998 Version

Is it a must-watch, pretty good, just another drama, tolerable or downright boring?

Ratings: Must Watch

Title：My Fair Princess / Princess Pearl / 还珠格格

Episodes and Genre: 1998-1999 Version – 72, 2011 Version – 90, Romance / Family Drama

Starring: 1998-1999

Vicki Zhao as Xiao Yan Zi

Ruby Lin as Xia Zi Wei

2009

Li Sheng as Xiao Yan Zi

Hai Lu as Xia Zi Wei

Synopsis:

Xiao Yan Zi is a fun-loving young girl who likes martial arts. She meets Xia Zi Wei, prim and proper and her polar opposite in personality. Xia Zi Wei is actually traveling to the Palace to meet her father Qian Long, the Emperor of Qing Dynasy.

Eager to help, Xiao Yan Zi volunteers to go to the Palace but crazy circumstances lead the Emperor to assume that Xiao Yan Zi is his daughter hence granting her the title of Princess.

Comments:

Based on Chiung Yao novels. Princess Pearl is a mega-hit back in 1998 that paved the way for Vicki Zhao and Ruby Lin to stardom. In fact, Fan Bing Bing who was a supporting character in this very successful drama also shot to fame and even starred in X-Men Days of Future Past as Blink. I read pretty negative reviews about the 2009 version though so it’s probably better to stick to the original.

This is not much of an wuxia but a classic in the Romance Drama genre. It has pretty one dimensional characters where the good are good and the antagonists Empress Dowager and Rong Muo Muo are monsters! Just kidding but you’ll know what I mean.

Justice Bao

Is it a must-watch, pretty good, just another drama, tolerable or downright boring?

Ratings: Must Watch

Title：Justice Bao / Bao Qing Tian / 包青天

Episodes and Genre: 1993-1994 Version – 236, Action Detective Drama

Starring:

Jin Chao Chun as Bao Zheng

Kenny Ho as Zhan Zhao
